This topic contains information on how the marriage dates requirement applies to survivor benefits for same-sex surviving spouses, including
when a marriage between same-sex individuals does not meet the one year marriage requirement
required elements for the duration of a marriage between individuals of the same-sex to be considered satisfied
evidence to establish that a same-sex couple
cohabitated beyond the marriage dates
, and
held themselves out to the public in a committed relationship
granting additional allowance for DIC to same-sex surviving spouse when the Veteran was totally disabled for eight years
granting or denying claims involving duration of marriage requirements
example of when
same-sex couple cohabitated and in a committed relationship one year prior to death
Veteran and same-sex surviving spouse recorded a civil union
Veteran and same-sex surviving spouse married after June 26, 2017
Veteran and same-sex surviving spouse did not cohabitate for one year
Veteran was totally disabled for eight years
, and
Veteran was totally disabled for eight years but the additional DIC allowance cannot be paid
, and

letters when granting or denying benefits to same-sex survivors
, and
the development letter to same-sex survivors
